sanskrit_verse:
भद्रं भद्रमिति ब्रूयाद्भद्रमित्येव वा वदेत् ।
शुष्कवैरं विवादं च न कुर्यात्केन चित्सह ॥ ४.१३९॥
transliteration:
bhadraṃ bhadramiti brūyād bhadramityeva vā vadet |
śuṣkavairaṃ vivādaṃ ca na kuryāt kena citsaha ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One shall speak only that which is auspicious and conducive to welfare; one shall not engage in conflict or dry enmity with anyone.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with universal well-being
Causation arises through speech and intent directed toward harmony
Capacity-based responsibility includes the power of speech to create or dissolve discord
Restoration logic operates by redirecting expression toward auspicious outcomes
Consciousness alignment requires abandonment of sterile opposition and adversarial framing
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent's utterance does not promote welfare THEN suppress output AND initiate restorative re-expression protocol
IF agent engages in dry enmity OR sterile conflict THEN trigger consciousness-realignment sequence AND disable adversarial interface
IF communication vector lacks auspicious intent THEN reallocate expressive capacity toward dharmic resonance channels
supreme_court_application: In adjudication, all parties must affirmatively express positions aligned with collective well-being. Dry enmity or procedural hostility disqualifies participation until consciousness realignment is verified. Courts must enforce linguistic purity as a threshold for legal standing.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that conflict arises from misaligned expression. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how sterile enmity distorts causality. Proportional responsibility lies in restoring correct expression. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that suppression of harmful speech restores dharma without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Mandatory completion of 'auspicious speech' training before re-engagement in discourse
Automated filtering of expressions lacking welfare-conducive intent
Responsibility assumption via public declaration of commitment to harmonious communication
Capacity restoration through guided vocal alignment with sacred sound principles
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this verse executes as pure Dharma. Conflict is dissolved through alignment of expression with universal auspiciousness. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
